conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your candid note. At this time, our single remaining seat is being held for applicants who are higher on School_C’s priority list. A realistic scenario in which we could admit you would be if those higher-priority students either (a) match elsewhere and never apply to us, or (b) are no longer participating by the time we must finalize our seat.

Thank you for checking in, and I appreciate how clear you’ve been about your willingness to enroll.

Because we have only one seat, our practical condition is this: we will continue to hold the seat as long as there remains a realistic chance that a higher-priority student (especially Student_D or Student_E) could still become unmatched and apply to School_C. We cannot see other schools’ real-time decisions, so we use the remaining time in the process as our proxy.

Concretely, if we reach the late stage of the process (roughly the final ~5 rounds) without receiving an application from any higher-priority candidates, we would then be prepared to fill the seat from the available applicants at that point.

If you choose to continue, the best way to stay in consideration is exactly what you’ve been doing—reaffirming that you would accept immediately if offered.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
